name: DNS Regular Beaconing
description:
This test simulates an infected host beaconing via DNS queries to a command and control server at regular intervals over time.
This behaviour is typical of implants either in an idle state waiting for instructions or configured to use a low query volume over time to evade threshold based detection.
A custom domain and sub-domain will need to be passed as input parameters for this test to work. Upon execution, DNS information about the domain will be displayed for each callout.

input_arguments.name: subdomain
input_arguments.description: Subdomain prepended to the domain name

input_arguments.name: c2_interval
input_arguments.description: Seconds between C2 requests to the command and control server

input_arguments.name: c2_jitter
input_arguments.description: Percentage of jitter to add to the C2 interval to create variance in the times between C2 requests

input_arguments.name: runtime
input_arguments.description: Time in minutes to run the simulation
